abstract: Researchers report in journal Nature that ocean did not rise six inches in 20th century, but actually rose only five inches; seemingly small discrepancy could help resolve longstanding conundrum in climate research concerning difference between best estimates of melt water from land ice and actual rise in sea levels that had been recorded at harbors around the world.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have reported that the ocean did not rise quite as much as previously believed in the 20th century, possibly explaining a discrepancy in climate research.
snippet: Researchers have reported that the ocean did not rise quite as much as previously believed in the 20th century, possibly explaining a discrepancy in climate research.

headline.main: New Research May Solve Puzzle in Sea Level’s Rise
headline.print_headline: New Research May Solve Puzzle in Sea Level’s Rise
